As for the copyright letters some of you have been getting. You gotta check on several factors but mainly, are you on fix IP? IF you are, do get a IP duper/masker. They can't trace what they can't verify. ALthough SOME may have you believe they can trace your IP to your door step, kindly ignore that. 

If you are connected via DSL with no fix IP, the best they can do is get you ISP to spill the beans. No amount of HACK programs can leech information like that from your ISP's database. If your ISP spills the beans, the most they can get is your phone number, the LAW can't do jack with information like that. Anyone can splice into your phones DSLAM. Basically, it's just not conclusive enough to nail you at court. 

And if you're really paranoid, there are ways to bounce your connection through several DNS and crap.... too technical to explain, easily understood by the initiated.

Peace~ 'Fuck' should be uttered in joy and excitement. Don't degrade it by using it to spread hate.

@danthedan:

First... "DivX Player?!"  That would be your first silly mistake, and probably the primary reason you can't play this video.  DivX "player" is a total waste of hard-drive space, existing only as part of the bundled junk that comes on top of the DivX codec download. It is basically a light-weight player developed to showcase the .divx format it came bundled with; it should not be mistaken for a universal video player that can play all formats without freaking out.  Download VLC player, or something similar, like GOM or Media Player Classic.  All free, all with built-in codecs.
Second: If you have a technical problem with a downloaded movie, etc. that came from a file, please THINK about your issue and who you should ask BEFORE YOU ANNOY EVERYONE HERE TIME AND TIME AGAIN. It's not about your experience or lack thereof; think about it. If you just GLANCE at the posts here, the video obviously works for a LOT of people.  Therefore, your issue is a technical issue, on YOUR computer.  This is not a tech-support forum, and since the uploader is not the creator and designer of the "complicated and cutting-edge" .avi technology, he doesn't need to include instructions on how to view it. Come on.  It's an AVI file, the most common shit out there.  AVI=hellacommon + works for everyone but you = stop ANNOYING US and post your questions on a tech site.  I have to scroll through 9 pages of posts just like yours to find audio/video ratings. ...look.  Not tryin to pick on you, this is a blanket angry vent cuz we get this exact crap ALL THE TIME, and you need an explanation of what a "noob" is so you know what it means as people much angrier than I throw a handful of expletives at your next post (or, like this time, just ignore your question entirely).  So, all done.  Rant complete.  What have I achieved here? Lets cover the facts.
- Read your post.  Caused annoyance levels to spike, triggering level 3 tantrum. Considered throwing a pencil.
- Thankfully, managed my wild recklessness by writing a post, to you and all the other "noobs" of the world, conveying how you all suck for polluting the boards with dumbness that takes time out of our day as we search for REAL info. 
-Ironically, wasted WAY more time than if I would have ignored it.  ...probably also the other board viewers, too.  Shit.  It's for a good cause!! ;)
-Answered your question. (Gotta admit, I ain't all THAT mean!)
